customData.content: 70-year-old male presented with a 2-month history of abdominal distension and pain.

HPI.summary: 70-year-old male presented with a 2-month history of abdominal distension and pain.

customData.content: Contrast-enhanced computed tomography of the abdomen revealed an intraperitoneal mass measuring 17 × 13 cm, located in the mid-abdomen and extending into left lumbar region. The lesion extended posteriorly, encasing the 3rd part of the duodenum, abutting the abdominal aorta, and further extending into the left lumbar region.

imaging.finding: Intraperitoneal mass measuring 17 × 13 cm, located in the mid-abdomen and extending into left lumbar region. The lesion extended posteriorly, encasing the 3rd part of the duodenum, abutting the abdominal aorta, and further extending into the left lumbar region.

customData.content: Trucut biopsy revealed a spindle cell neoplasm on histopathological examination.
IHC staining: SMA+, S100 (patchy +), desmin+, CD34-, ALK-, CD117-. Diagnosis: low-grade myofibroblastic/smooth muscle neoplasm.

diagnoses.label: Malignant neoplasm of bone and articular cartilage of unspecified sites

customData.content: Peritoneal fluid: benign and reactive mesothelial cells with atypical epithelioid cells (coarse nuclear chromatin, prominent nucleoli, abundant cytoplasm).

labs.value: benign and reactive mesothelial cells with atypical epithelioid cells (coarse nuclear chromatin, prominent nucleoli, abundant cytoplasm)

customData.content: Cytology: cells showing binucleation and multinucleation. IHC: SMA+, calretinin-. MDM2 IHC: diffuse nuclear positivity. Cytology reported as positive for malignancy, suggestive of metastatic deposits of dedifferentiated liposarcoma.

labs.finding: positive for malignancy, suggestive of metastatic deposits of dedifferentiated liposarcoma

diagnoses.label: Malignant neoplasm of connective and soft tissue, unspecified

customData.content: Resection specimen: large intraperitoneal mass measuring 18 × 17 cm with adhered intestinal loops. Histopathology: predominantly low-grade, spindle cell neoplasm with areas exhibiting high-grade features, characterized by cells with epithelioid morphology, enlarged nuclei, multinucleation consistent with findings from cytological evaluation.

imaging.finding: large intraperitoneal mass measuring 18 × 17 cm with adhered intestinal loops

customData.content: IHC: Retained H3K27me3 expression, myogenin and myoD1 negativity, diffuse MDM2 and p16 positivity. Diagnosis: dedifferentiated liposarcoma.

diagnoses.label: Malignant neoplasm of overlapping sites of retroperitoneum and peritoneum

customData.content: Postoperative period was uneventful. Regular follow-up for the past 6 months with no specific complaints or evidence of relapse.

HPI.summary: Postoperative period was uneventful. Regular follow-up for the past 6 months with no specific complaints or evidence of relapse.

data.content: Patient presented with abdominal distension and pain, leading to imaging.
CT scan revealed a large intraperitoneal mass, prompting a biopsy.
Biopsy revealed a spindle cell neoplasm, leading to IHC staining and diagnosis.
Diagnosis of low-grade myofibroblastic/smooth muscle neoplasm, prompting peritoneal fluid analysis.
Peritoneal fluid analysis showed atypical cells, leading to cytology and IHC.
Cytology suggested metastatic dedifferentiated liposarcoma, leading to resection.
Resection specimen showed a large mass, leading to further IHC and diagnosis.
Diagnosis of dedifferentiated liposarcoma, followed by uneventful postoperative period and follow-up.
